{{Infobox football biography | name = Henrikh Mkhitaryan | image = Henrikh Mkhitaryan 2017.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Mkhitaryan with [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in 2017 | fullname = Henrikh Mkhitaryan{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|1|21|df=y}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/5102/Henrikh-Mkhitaryan/overview |title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=4 October 2018}} | birth_place = [[Yerevan]], [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Armenian SSR]],
[[Soviet Union]] | height = 1.77 m | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 7 | youthyears1 = 1995–2006 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Pyunik|Pyunik]] | years1 = 2006–2009 | clubs1 = [[FC Pyunik|Pyunik]] | caps1 = 70 | goals1 = 30 | years2 = 2009–2010 | clubs2 = [[FC Metalurh Donetsk|Metalurh Donetsk]] | caps2 = 37 | goals2 = 12 | years3 = 2010–2013 | clubs3 = [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] | caps3 = 72 | goals3 = 38 | years4 = 2013–2016 | clubs4 = [[Borussia Dortmund]] | caps4 = 90 | goals4 = 23 | years5 = 2016–2018 | clubs5 = [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] | caps5 = 39 | goals5 = 5 | years6 = 2018– | clubs6 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps6 = 29 | goals6 = 8 | nationalyears1 = 2006–2007 | nationalteam1 = [[Armenia national under-17 football team|Armenia U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2007–2008 | nationalteam2 = [[Armenia national under-19 football team|Armenia U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2008–2010 | nationalteam3 = [[Armenia national under-21 football team|Armenia U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 13 | nationalgoals3 = 9 | nationalyears4 = 2007– | nationalteam4 = [[Armenia national football team|Armenia]] | nationalcaps4 = 80 | nationalgoals4 = 26 | club-update = 2 March 2019 | nationalteam-update = 19:46, 30 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Henrikh Mkhitaryan''' ({{lang-hy|Հենրիխ Մխիթարյան}}, {{IPA-hy|hɛnˈɾiχ məχitʰɑˈɾjɑn||Henrikh-Mkhitaryan.ogg}}; born 21 January 1989) is an Armenian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and captains the [[Armenia national football team|Armenian national team]]. Mkhitaryan plays mainly as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], but can also be deployed as a [[Midfielder#Wide midfielder|wide midfielder]]. Born in [[Yerevan]], Mkhitaryan began his senior career at local club [[FC Pyunik|Pyunik]] at age 17, and was instrumental in the side's success in domestic competition, winning four successive [[Armenian Premier League]] titles and an [[Armenian Cup]]. His success caught the attention of Ukrainian side [[Metalurh Donetsk]], where he remained for a singular season before transferring to perennial [[Ukrainian Premier League]] champions and city rivals [[Shakhtar Donetsk]] in 2010, for a fee of €6.1 million. During his time at Shakhtar, Mkhitaryan became renowned for his goalscoring prowess and footballing intelligence, and gained comparisons to [[Zinedine Zidane]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/jun/19/henrikh-mkhitaryan-shakhtar-donetsk-jonathan-wilson |work=The Guardian|date= 19 June 2013|accessdate= 19 November 2014|title=Liverpool target Henrikh Mkhitaryan owes much to heritage and hard work | first = Jonathan | last = Wilson}} Mkhitaryan would register a goal involvement every 0.75 games at Shakhtar, including a [[Ukrainian Premier League#Champions and top goalscorers|league record goal scoring total]] of 25 in [[2012–13 Ukrainian Premier League|2012–13]], while also being named [[Ukrainian Footballer of the Year#Komanda|Ukrainian Premier League Footballer of the Year]]. After achieving a [[Double (association football)|domestic double]] in three of his four seasons in Shakhtar, his exploits in Ukraine eventually attracted [[Bundesliga]] club [[Borussia Dortmund]], who signed the player after protracted negotiations for a club-record fee of €27.5 million,{{cite news|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan disappoints Liverpool by joining Borussia|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jul/09/henrikh-mkhitaryan-joins-borussia-dortmund|accessdate=10 July 2013|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=9 July 2013}} making him the most expensive Armenian player of all time. In Germany, Mkhitaryan established himself as one of the best midfielders in Europe, with his creative and goalscoring abilities firing Dortmund to a [[DFL-Supercup]] in [[2014 DFL-Supercup|2014]]. During the [[2015–16 Bundesliga|following campaign]], he registered the most number of [[Assist (football)|assists]] in the Bundesliga, with 15, which ranked him second for the most in Europe.{{citeweb|url=https://talksport.com/football/premier-league-201516-top-ten-players-most-assists-160515195918?p=9|title=2015/16: Top ten players with the most assists|publisher=TalkSport|accessdate=April 6, 2018}} However, after again featuring as a runner-up in the Bundesliga, Mkhitaryan relocated to England to join [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in a deal worth £30 million (€34.3 million), becoming the first Armenian to play in the [[Premier League]].{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jul/06/manchester-united-henrikh-mkhitaryan-signs|title=Manchester United complete signing of Henrikh Mkhitaryan on four-year deal|newspaper=The Guardian|date=6 July 2016|accessdate=10 August 2016}} Mkhitaryan's debut season saw him win the [[2016 FA Community Shield|FA Community Shield]], while also scoring the winner as United attained their first [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|UEFA Europa League]] title.{{cite web |url=http://www.uefa.org/newsfiles/uefacup/2017/2019702_fr.pdf |title=Full Time Report Final – Ajax v Manchester United |website=UEFA.org |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |format=PDF |date=24 May 2017 |accessdate=24 May 2017}} Mkhitaryan stayed a season and a half in Manchester, before lukewarm form and disillusionment with the club's footballing philosophy led him to sign for rivals Arsenal in a deal in 2018.{{cite web|last1=Bairner|first1=Robin|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan signs as Alexis leaves club|url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/henrikh-mkhitaryan-signs-alexis-leaves-club|website=[[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]'s official website|accessdate=22 January 2018|date=22 January 2018}} Mkhitaryan has been a member of the senior side in his native country since 2007. He is Armenia's all-time top goalscorer, scoring 26 goals in 80 international matches, as well as registering their first [[hat-trick]]. He has been named [[Armenian Footballer of the Year]] seven times, being awarded the distinction every year since 2009 (with the exception of 2010). He was voted the [[Footballer of the Year in Baltic and Commonwealth of Independent States (Sport-Express)|CIS Footballer of the Year]] for 2012, making him the first Armenian footballer to be named the best player from post-Soviet countries.{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan – CIS player of the year|url=http://www.ffa.am/en/-CIS-player-/page/5|publisher=FFA.am|accessdate=3 March 2013|date=10 January 2013}} He received the award again for 2013.{{cite web | url = http://www.sports.ru/football/158408068.html | script-title=ru:Мхитарян стал лучшим футболистом 2013 года в странах СНГ и Балтии | language = Russian | publisher = sports.ru | date = 5 March 2014 | accessdate = 5 March 2014}} ==Early life== Mkhitaryan was born on 21 January 1989 in the Soviet Armenian capital [[Yerevan]] to Marina Taschyan and [[Hamlet Mkhitaryan (born 1962)|Hamlet Mkhitaryan]]. His father was a prominent striker for [[FC Ararat Yerevan]] during the 1980s, who died of a [[brain tumor]] at age 33 when Henrikh was seven years old.{{cite news|title=Հենրիխ Մխիթարյան. Գնահատում եմ նույնիսկ իմ թշնամիներին, որոնք ինձ ավելի ուժեղ են դարձնում|trans-title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: I even value my enemies, because they make me stronger|url=http://www.tert.am/am/news/2011/05/14/mkhitaryan/|newspaper=[[Tert.am]]|accessdate=14 June 2012|language=Armenian|date=14 May 2011}} Marina Taschyan's mother was [[Russians|Russian]] from [[Moscow]].https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/09/russia-love-man-utds-mkhitaryan/ The death of his father impacted Mkhitaryan significantly. He feels that if his father was still alive that "everything would be different." He gave him useful advice from a professional point of view. People who have watched Mkhitaryan and his father, say that their styles resemble each other very much. He has said, "I believe he sees me and is proud of me…"{{cite news|script-title=hy:"Ես հավատում եմ, որ նա ինձ տեսնում է...". Հենրիխ Մխիթարյան|url=http://armenpress.am/arm/news/707550/%E2%80%9Ci-believe-he-sees-me-%E2%80%9D-henrikh-mkhitaryan.html|newspaper=[[Armenpress]]|accessdate=1 March 2013| language = Armenian|date=7 February 2013}}{{cite news|script-title=hy:Հենրիխ Մխիթարյանը իր ֆուտբոլային հաջողությունները կապում է հայրական գեների հետ|url=http://armenpress.am/arm/news/704721/|newspaper=[[Armenpress]]|accessdate=3 March 2013 | language = Armenian | date = 11 January 2013}} His mother is the head of the national teams department in the [[Football Federation of Armenia|Armenian Football Federation]] and his elder sister, Monica, works at [[UEFA|UEFA's]] headquarters.{{cite web|title=Sabre Dance by Henrikh Mkhitaryan|url=http://ukrainianfootball1894.blogspot.co.uk/2012/08/sabre-dance-by-henrikh-mkhitaryan.html|publisher=Ukrainian Football 1894|accessdate=22 August 2012 | date = 16 August 2012}} At the beginning of the 1990s, the Mkhitaryan family moved to [[France]], where Hamlet Mkhitaryan played for the now defunct [[ASOA Valence]] and helped them to be promoted to the second division. Mkhitaryan spent his early childhood in [[Valence, Drôme|Valence]].{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/oct/22/henrik-mkhitaryan-shakhtar-donetsk |work=The Guardian|date= 22 October 2012|accessdate= 1 March 2013|title=Henrik Mkhitaryan orchestrates Shakhtar Donetsk's great leap forward}} He always wanted to become a football player and began to follow in his father's footsteps. As a child, he would watch his father play and always wanted to follow him to training. The Mkhitaryans returned to Yerevan in 1995. In the same year, Mkhitaryan joined the youth system of [[FC Pyunik]]. He graduated from the [[Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture|Institute of Physical Culture in Armenia]]. He studied [[economics]] at the Yerevan branch of the [[St. Petersburg Institute of International Trade, Economics and Law|St. Petersburg Institute]]. Upon graduation, he planned to study there as a [[lawyer]].{{cite web|title=Juve been warned: Henrikh Mkhitaryan is Europe's most in-form player|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1717/editorial/2012/10/02/3415955/juve-been-warned-henrikh-mkhitaryan-is-europes-most-in-form |publisher=goal.com | accessdate=1 March 2013 | date = 2 October 2012 | first = Michael | last = Yokhin}}{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: I never take the praise, if I know that I played badly|url=http://www.panorama.am/en/interviews/2013/02/27/mkhitaryan/|publisher=panorama.am|accessdate=3 March 2013 | date = 27 February 2013}} In 2003, Mkhitaryan, aged 14 had trials with [[São Paulo F.C.|São Paulo]] in Brazil where he played alongside the likes of [[Hernanes]] and [[Oscar (footballer, born 1991)|Oscar]].{{cite news|url=http://www.bvb.de/eng/Teams/First-Team/Henrikh-Mkhitaryan |work=[[Borussia Dortmund]] |accessdate=26 March 2015 |title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131205010220/http://www.bvb.de/eng/Teams/First-Team/Henrikh-Mkhitaryan |archivedate=5 December 2013 }} He returned to [[FC Pyunik|Pyunik]] in 2004, then manager [[Mihai Stoichiță]] insisted on his return to Armenia. Growing up, Mkhitaryan considered [[Zinedine Zidane]] his football idol.{{cite web|title=Armenia’s got talent|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/24833|publisher=shakhtar.com|accessdate=1 March 2013 | date = 9 December 2012}} ==Club career== ===Pyunik=== Mkhitaryan joined the [[FC Pyunik]] youth system in 1995 and received his first salary at the age of 15.{{cite web|script-title=hy:Հենրիխ Մխիթարյան. Հատկապես ուրախ եմ եղել 15 տարեկանում "Փյունիկում" ստացած առաջին աշխատավարձիս|url=http://sport.news.am/arm/news/17354/henrikh-mkhitaryan-hatkapes-urakh-em-exel-15-tarekanum-pyunikum-stacats-arajin-ashkhatavardzis.html|publisher=sport.news.am|accessdate=1 March 2013 | language = Armenian | date = 11 January 2013}} He was later promoted to the first team of [[FC Pyunik]], making his professional debut in 2006 at the age of 17. He last played for the club in the [[2009 Armenian Premier League|2009 season]]. During that season he scored 11 league goals in 10 league games. In his four seasons in the Pyunik first team, they won the Armenian Premier League on four occasions (2006, 2007, 2008 and 2009). They also won the [[Armenian Supercup]] twice (2007 and 2009) and the [[Armenian Cup]] once (2009). [[Armenia national football team|Armenian national team]] and Pyunik head coach [[Vardan Minasyan]] admitted that he would love to see his star player "playing in a stronger league." Minasyan stated young Henrikh was well on his way to becoming a legend in his own right. He said of Mkhitaryan, "He can win games on his own. He seizes control at the crucial moment and scores for fun."{{cite web|title=Mkhitaryan worthy of a higher calling|url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=arm/news/newsid=832354.html|publisher=UEFA.com|accessdate=1 March 2013 | date = 22 May 2009 | first = Khachik | last = Chakhoyan}} Due to his success in the [[2009 Armenian Premier League]] at [[Pyunik Yerevan]], he joined [[Ukrainian Premier League]] club [[Metalurh Donetsk]]. ===Metalurh Donetsk=== [[File:Генрих Мхитарян.jpg|thumb|upright|Mkhitaryan playing for Metalurh Donetsk in 2009]] Mkhitaryan joined [[FC Metalurh Donetsk|Metalurh Donetsk]] in 2009.{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2012/m=9/news=mkhitaryan-earning-place-among-the-elite-1713385.html|title=Mkhitaryan earning a place among the elite|work=FIFA|date=29 September 2012|accessdate=1 October 2017}} He scored a goal on his debut in a 3–0 victory against [[Belarusian Premier League]] side [[FC Partizan Minsk]], in the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] on 16 July 2009.{{cite web|title=Metalurh vs Partizan Minsk|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/07/16/europe/uefa-cup/fc-metalurh-donetsk/fc-mtz-ripo-minsk/803474/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 16 July 2009}} On 19 July 2009, he made his [[2009–10 Ukrainian Premier League|league]] debut in a 0–0 draw with [[FC Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk|Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk]].{{cite web|title=Metalurh vs Dnipro 0–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/07/19/ukraine/premier-league/fc-metalurh-donetsk/fc-dnipro-dnipropetrovsk/786472/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 19 July 2009}} His first league goal came in a 2–2 draw with [[FC Karpaty Lviv|Karpaty Lviv]] on 26 July 2009.{{cite web|title=Karpaty vs Metalurh 2–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/07/26/ukraine/premier-league/fc-karpaty-lviv/fc-metalurh-donetsk/786478/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 26 July 2009}} On 6 August 2009, he scored the first goal in a 3–0 second leg Europa League win against [[Slovenia]]n [[NK Bravo1 Interblock|Interblock Ljubljana]], winning 5–0 on aggregate.{{cite web|title=Interblock vs Metalurh 0–3|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2009/08/06/europe/uefa-cup/nk-interblock-ljubljana/fc-metalurh-donetsk/814082/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 6 August 2009}} The following [[2010–11 Ukrainian Premier League|season]] he was named captain of the club on 14 July 2010, at the age 21, making him the youngest captain in Metalurh Donetsk history.{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: ‘The Maestro’ of Armenian Soccer|url=http://www.armenianweekly.com/2011/01/29/the-maestro/|publisher=www.armenianweekly.com|accessdate=22 August 2012 | date = 29 January 2011 | first = Antranig | last = Dereyan}} He scored his first goal of the season, an 89th-minute penalty, in a 3–0 victory over Obolon Kyiv on 16 July 2010.{{cite web|title=Metalurh vs Obolon 3–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/07/16/ukraine/premier-league/fc-metalurh-donetsk/fc-obolon-kyiv/943170/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 16 July 2010}} He played his final match for the club in a 2–1 win against Dnipro on 30 August 2010.{{cite web|title=Dnipro vs Metalurh 1–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/08/30/ukraine/premier-league/fc-dnipro-dnipropetrovsk/fc-metalurh-donetsk/943220/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 30 August 2010}} In his second season, he played eight matches and scored three goals, all of which were in the league. He made 37 league appearances during his time at Metalurh, scoring 12 goals.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/henrikh-mkhitaryan/39797/|title=H. Mkhitaryan|work=Soccerway|publisher=Global Sports Media|accessdate=21 January 2012}} In total he played 45 matches for the club, scoring 16 times. ===Shakhtar Donetsk=== ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Heinrich Mkhitaryan1.jpg|thumb|left|Mkhitaryan training with Shakhtar in 2010]] On 30 August 2010, he sealed a $7.5 million switch to reigning [[Ukrainian Premier League|Premier League]] champions [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]].{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan seals FC Shakhtar switch|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/14174|accessdate=20 September 2012 | date = 30 August 2010 | publisher = shakhtar.com}} Before signing with Shakhtar, Mikhtaryan was in trial with [[Iran Pro League]] side [[Mes Kerman F.C.|Mes Kerman]] which he was rejected by head coach [[Samad Marfavi]].{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan was rejected by Mes in 2010|url=http://www.fartakvarzeshi.ir/%D8%A8%D8%AE%D8%B4-%D9%81%D9%88%D8%AA%D8%A8%D8%A7%D9%84-3/13387-%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%A7%D8%B1%D9%87-%D9%81%D8%B9%D9%84%DB%8C-%D9%85%D9%86%DA%86%D8%B3%D8%AA%D8%B1%DB%8C%D9%88%D9%86%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%AA%D8%AF-%D8%AF%D8%B1-%D8%AA%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%B3-%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B4%DA%AF%D8%A7%D9%87-%D9%84%DB%8C%DA%AF-%DB%8C%DA%A9%DB%8C-%D8%A8%D9%88%D8%AF-%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%B4%DA%AF%D8%A7%D9%87%DB%8C-%DA%A9%D9%87-%D9%82%D8%AF%D8%B1-%D9%81%D8%B1%D8%B5%D8%AA-%D8%B7%D9%84%D8%A7%DB%8C%DB%8C-%D8%A7%D8%B4-%D8%B1%D8%A7-%D9%86%D8%AF%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%B3%D8%AA|accessdate=5 September 2016 | date = 10 September 2016 | publisher = fartakvarzeshi.ir}} His debut came on 10 September 2010 in a 1–0 away league defeat to [[FC Obolon Kyiv|Obolon Kyiv]], being replaced after 62 minutes by [[Eduardo da Silva|Eduardo]].{{cite web|title=Obolon vs Shakhtar 1–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/09/10/ukraine/premier-league/fc-obolon-kyiv/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/943226/|accessdate=18 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 10 September 2010}} His [[Donbass Arena|home]] debut was more successful, with Shakhtar coming back from a goal behind to win 4–1 against [[SC Tavriya Simferopol|Tavriya Simferopol]] on 19 September 2010.{{cite web|title=Shakhtar vs Tavriya 4–1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/09/19/ukraine/premier-league/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/sc-tavriya-simferopol/943234/|accessdate=18 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 19 September 2010}} He scored his first goal for the club in this match. Three days later he made his first appearance in the [[2010–11 Ukrainian Cup|Ukrainian Cup]], netting the second goal in a 6–0 win over [[FC Kryvbas Kryvyi Rih|Kryvbas]].{{cite web|title=Shakhtar vs Kryvbas 6–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/09/22/ukraine/cup/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/fc-kryvbas-kryvyi-rih/1027677/|accessdate=18 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 22 September 2010}} On 25 September 2010, he scored a late injury time winner in a 2–1 away victory over [[FC Metalist Kharkiv|Metalist Kharkiv]].{{cite web|title=Metalist vs Shakhtar 1–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2010/09/25/ukraine/premier-league/fc-metalist-kharkiv/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/943243/|accessdate=18 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 25 September 2010}} He made his European debut for the club in the [[2010–11 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] on 28 September 2010 against [[Sporting Braga]] winning 3–0.{{cite web|title=Henrik Mkhitaryan: Braga level is not our concern|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/15322|publisher=Shakhtar.com|accessdate=14 June 2012 | date = 3 December 2010}} He made an appearance in the 2–0 [[2011 Ukrainian Cup Final|Ukrainian Cup Final]] victory against [[FC Dynamo Kyiv|Dynamo Kyiv]], coming on in the 81st minute in place of [[Jádson]].{{cite web|title=Dynamo vs Shakhtar 0–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/05/25/ukraine/cup/fc-dynamo-kyiv/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/1109959/|accessdate=18 September 2012| publisher = Soccerway | date = 25 May 2011}} His first [[2010–11 FC Shakhtar Donetsk season|season]] with the club was extremely successful for Shakhtar as they won the treble ([[2010–11 Ukrainian Premier League|Premier League]], [[2010–11 Ukrainian Cup|Ukrainian Cup]] and the [[Ukrainian Super Cup|Super Cup]]).{{cite web|title=Ukraine 2010/11|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tableso/oekr2011.html | accessdate = 21 July 2013 | publisher = RSSSF | date = 12 December 2011 | first = Fedya | last = Fussball}} ====2011–12 season==== [[File:Генрих Мхитарян 1.jpeg|thumb|upright|Mkhitaryan playing for [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in 2011]] In the [[2011–12 FC Shakhtar Donetsk season|2011–12 season]] Shakhtar won the [[2011-12 Ukrainian Premier League|Premier League]] and the [[2011–12 Ukrainian Cup|Ukrainian Cup]].{{cite web|title=Ukraine 2011/12|url=http://www.rsssf.com/tableso/oekr2012.html | accessdate = 21 July 2013 | publisher = RSSSF | date = 20 September 2012 | first = Fedya | last = Fussball}} Mkhitaryan scored the third goal in a 4–0 win against [[FC Obolon Kyiv|Obolon Kyiv]] in his first league match of the season.{{cite web|title=Shakhtar Donetsk vs Obolon 4–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2011/07/10/ukraine/premier-league/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/fc-obolon-kyiv/1116722/|accessdate=15 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 10 July 2011}} On 4 March 2012, he scored the equalizing goal in a 1–1 draw with [[FC Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk|Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk]].{{cite web|title=Shakhtar Donetsk vs Dnipro 1–1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/03/04/ukraine/premier-league/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/fc-dnipro-dnipropetrovsk/1218368/|accessdate=15 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 4 March 2012}} He scored the only goal in a [[2011–12 Ukrainian Cup|cup]] victory over [[FC Metalurh Zaporizhya|Metalurh Zaporizhya]] on 11 April 2012.{{cite web|title=Metalurh Zaporizhya vs Shakhtar Donetsk 0–1|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/04/11/ukraine/cup/fc-metalurh-zaporizhya/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/1274123/|accessdate=15 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 11 April 2012}} On 6 May 2012, he played a part in Shakhtar's 2–1 extra time victory over his former team [[FC Metalurh Donetsk|Metalurh Donetsk]] in the [[2012 Ukrainian Cup Final|Ukrainian Cup Final]], coming off after 62 minutes for [[Douglas Costa]].{{cite web|title=Metalurh Donetsk vs Shakhtar Donetsk 1–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/05/06/ukraine/cup/fc-metalurh-donetsk/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/1279360/|accessdate=15 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 6 May 2012}} In an online poll on [[Shakhtar Donetsk]]'s official website, Mkhitaryan was voted as the best player of Shakhtar in [[2011–12 Ukrainian Premier League|2011–12 Premier League season]] with about 38% of total votes.{{cite web|script-title=ru:Лучший игрок "Шахтера" в Премьер-лиге – 2011/12|url=http://shakhtar.com/ru/vote/?votename=1336979951872|publisher=Shakhtar.com|accessdate=16 May 2012|language=Russian|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014174305/http://shakhtar.com/ru/vote/?votename=1336979951872|archivedate=14 October 2013|df=dmy-all}} He scored 11 goals in 37 matches, including 10 goals in 26 league matches. Shakhtar retained the [[2011–12 Ukrainian Premier League|Premier League]] and the [[2011–12 Ukrainian Cup|Ukrainian Cup]] in the [[2011–12 FC Shakhtar Donetsk season|2011–12 season]]. ====2012–13 season==== {{Quote box | width=30% | align=left| quote="It wasn't easy for him from the start, but his integration was speeded up by his high level of football intelligence. His game awareness is perhaps his most valuable quality – that and the speed and power and technique Henrikh was gifted by nature and that he's developed. Because of those virtues, he's one of the players who most consistently fulfils the tasks set by the coaching staff. Working with him is fun."|source=—[[Mircea Lucescu]], Mkhitaryan's manager at [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]] in June 2013.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2013/jun/19/henrikh-mkhitaryan-shakhtar-donetsk-jonathan-wilson |work=The Guardian|date= 19 June 2013|accessdate= 19 November 2014|title=Liverpool target Henrikh Mkhitaryan owes much to heritage and hard work | first = Jonathan | last = Wilson}}}} Mkhitaryan played in Shakhtar's 2–0 [[Ukrainian Super Cup|2012 Super Cup]] victory over [[FC Metalurh Donetsk|Metalurh Donetsk]].{{cite web|title=Metalurh vs Shakhtar 0–2|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/07/10/ukraine/super-cup/fc-metalurh-donetsk/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/1285429/|accessdate= 13 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 10 July 2012}} In his first match of the [[2012–13 Ukrainian Premier League|2012–13 Premier League season]], he scored twice and provided two assists in a 6–0 season opening victory against [[FC Arsenal Kyiv|Arsenal Kyiv]].{{cite web|title= Shakhtar Donetsk vs Arsenal Kyiv 6–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/07/15/ukraine/premier-league/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/fc-arsenal-kyiv/1289235/|accessdate=13 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 15 July 2012}} He managed a hat-trick against [[Chornomorets Odesa]]{{cite web|title=Chornomorets vs Shakhtar 1–5|url= https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/08/19/ukraine/premier-league/fc-chornomorets-odessa/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/1289274/|accessdate=13 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 19 August 2012}} in a 5–1 win to reach 10 goals for the season after just six games, equaling his tally for the previous season. On 19 September 2012, in Shakhtar's first [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] [[2012–13 UEFA Champions League group stage|match]] of the season, Mkhitaryan scored twice in a 2–0 victory over [[2011–12 Danish Superliga|Danish champions]] [[FC Nordsjælland|Nordsjælland]].{{cite web|title=Shakhtar vs Nordsjælland 2–0|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2012/09/19/europe/uefa-champions-league/joint-stock-company-fc-shakhtar-donetsk/fc-nordsjalland/1388722/|accessdate=20 September 2012 | publisher = Soccerway | date = 19 September 2012}} This was the first time he had scored a goal in the [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] and he was named Man of the Match.{{cite web|title=Mkhitaryan named the Man of the Match|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/23533 | accessdate = 21 July 2013 | date = 20 September 2012 | publisher = Shakhtar Donetsk}} He was also named in the Team of the Week for match day 1 of the Champions League after his brace against Nordsjælland.{{cite web|title=Mkhitaryan named in the Team of the Week|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/23573| date = 21 September 2012 | accessdate = 21 July 2013 | publisher = Shakhtar Donetsk}}{{cite web |script-title=uk:Чемпіонат ПЛ |url=http://www.fpl.ua/ukr/fans/liga/ |publisher=fpl.ua |accessdate=4 March 2013 |language=Ukrainian |title= Прем'єр-ліга - Офіційний сайт |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100729145528/http://www.fpl.ua/ukr/fans/liga/ |archive-date=29 July 2010 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 16 March 2013, Mkhitaryan played his 100th game in the [[Ukrainian Premier League]] in a match against [[FC Chornomorets Odesa|Chornomorets Odesa]].{{cite web|script-title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan playing 100th match in Ukrainian championship|url=https://sport.news.am/eng/news/20705/|publisher=sport.news.am| date = 16 March 2013}}{{cite web|script-title=hy:Հենրիխ Մխիթարյանի հերթական գոլը|url=https://sport.news.am/arm/news/20706/|publisher=sport.news.am|accessdate=17 March 2013 | language = Armenian | date = 16 March 2013}} On 11 May 2013, Mkhitaryan scored his 23rd and 24th goals of the Premier League season in a 5–0 victory over Tavria. These goals set a [[Ukrainian Premier League]] record for most goals in a season.{{cite news|title=Shakhtar vs Tavriya: Mkhitaryan set the record|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/26783|accessdate=9 June 2013|date=11 May 2013|agency=FC Shakhtar Donetsk}}{{cite news|title=Super Heno!: Armenian soccer player sets new goal-scoring record for Ukrainian championship|url=http://www.armenianow.com/sports/soccer/45997/armenia_soccer_henrikh_mkhitaryan_goal_record_ukraine_championship|date=13 May 2013|agency=[[ArmeniaNow]] | accessdate = 21 July 2013}} Mkhitaryan finished the season with 25 league goals, and the attacking midfielder was praised for his technique and dedication.{{cite web | url = http://www.ua-football.com/ukrainian/high/51cae409.html | script-title=ru:Символическая сборная УПЛ сезона-2012/2013. Тур за туром | language = Russian | publisher = ua-football.com | date = 27 June 2013 | accessdate = 19 July 2013}} ===Borussia Dortmund=== ====2013–14 season==== On 25 June 2013, Borussia Dortmund made a €25 million ($30 million) bid,{{cite news|last=Drayton|first=John|title=Shakhtar open to Mkhitaryan offers as Anzhi join Liverpool and Dortmund in £25m chase|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2350019/Shakhtar-open-Henrikh-Mkhitaryan-offers-Anzhi-join-Liverpool-Dortmund-25m-chase.html|accessdate=27 June 2013|newspaper=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=27 June 2013}}{{cite web |last=Lee|first=Sam|title= Borussia Dortmund launch €23 million bid for Mkhitaryan |url=http://www.goal.com/en-ng/news/4102/transfer-zone/2013/06/26/4075934/borussia-dortmund-launch-23-million-bid-for-mkhitaryan|accessdate=27 June 2013| publisher =Goal.com|date=26 June 2013}} but in confirming the offer Shakhtar Donetsk CEO Sergei Palkin insisted that it fell short of the club's valuation, which was a single payment of €30 million ($36 million). In the same press conference, Palkin confirmed the acquisition of Brazilian [[Frederico Rodrigues Santos|Fred]] from [[Sport Club Internacional]] for €15 million (£12.5 million), a likely replacement.{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11669/8794018/Transfer-news-Borussia-Dortmund-have-bid-for-Henrikh-Mkhitaryan|title=Borussia Dortmund have bid for Henrikh Mkhitaryan|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=26 June 2013|accessdate=26 June 2013}} On 5 July 2013, it was reported that Borussia Dortmund had succeeded in talks with Shakhtar and Mkhitaryan was on his way to Germany for a medical test.{{cite news|last=Edwards|first=John|title=Dortmund beat Liverpool and Spurs to £20m-rated playmaker Mkhitaryan|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2356872/Borussia-Dortmund-beat-Liverpool-Henrikh-Mkhitaryan.html?ico=sport%5Eheadlines|accessdate=5 July 2013|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|date=5 July 2013}}{{cite news|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: Liverpool target set for Borussia Dortmund|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23207884|accessdate=6 July 2013|date=5 July 2013|agency=BBC Sport}}{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=David|title=Liverpool set to miss out on Henrikh Mkhitaryan who is Borussia Dortmund bound after Shakhtar Donetsk accept £21.5m bid|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/liverpool-transfers-henrikh-mkhitaryan-looks-2030353|accessdate=6 July 2013|newspaper=Daily Mirror|date=6 July 2013}} On 8 July 2013, Borussia Dortmund announced that it was set to sign a four-year deal with Mkhitaryan for €25 million (£21.5 million){{cite news|last=Christenson|first=Marcus|title= Liverpool set to miss out on No1 summer target Henrikh Mkhitaryan |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jul/05/henrikh-mkhitaryan-dortmund-liverpool-transfer|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=5 July 2013}}{{cite news|title=Dortmund win race for Shakhtar's Mkhitaryan|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=1969552.html |accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=uefa.com|date=8 July 2013}}{{cite news|last=Turnbull|first=Craig|title=Dortmund confirm Mkhitaryan transfer|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2013/07/08/4103038/breaking-news-dortmund-confirm-mkhitaryan-deal|accessdate=8 July 2013|newspaper=Goal.com|date=8 July 2013}}{{cite news|title=Dortmund expected to tie up 'difficult' Mkhitaryan deal|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/sport/story/219785.html|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=8 July 2013|agency=[[ESPN]]}} Shakhtar and Borussia officially "resolved all the necessary formalities" and agreed on €27.5 million (£23.6 million),{{cite news|title=Shakhtar parted with Mkhitaryan|url=http://shakhtar.com/en/news/27453|accessdate=8 July 2013|date=9 July 2013|agency=FC Shakhtar Donetsk}} making him the most expensive purchase in the club's history.{{cite news|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan's transfer – most expensive in Borussia's history|url=http://armenpress.am/eng/news/725381/henrikh-mkhitaryan%E2%80%99s-transfer-%E2%80%93-most-expensive-in-borussia%E2%80%99s-history.html|accessdate=10 July 2013|newspaper=[[Armenpress]]|date=9 July 2013}} On his debut in a pre-season friendly against [[FC Basel]] on 10 July 2013, Mkhitaryan set up a goal for [[Marco Reus]] in the 11th minute and scored his first goal for the club 16 minutes later, helping his side to a 3–1 victory away at [[St. Jakob-Park]].{{cite news|title=Basel 1–3 Borussia Dortmund: Mkhitaryan shines in impressive debut|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/15/germany/2013/07/10/4108683/basel-1-3-borussia-dortmund-mkhitaryan-shines-in-impressive|date=10 July 2013|newspaper=Goal.com|accessdate=13 July 2013}}{{cite news|title=Mkhitaryan dazzles on debut|url=http://espnfc.com/news/story?id=1496278&cc=3888|date=11 July 2013|newspaper=[[ESPN FC]]|accessdate=13 July 2013 | first = Stephan | last = Uersfeld}}{{cite news|title=Dortmund star Henrikh Mkhitaryan gives Liverpool boss Brendon Rodgers a taste of what might have been: Video|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/07/11/dortmund-star-henrikh-mkhitaryan-gives-liverpool-boss-brendon-rodgers-a-taste-of-what-might-have-been-video-3878025/|date=11 July 2013|newspaper=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]|accessdate=13 July 2013 | first = Jack | last = Fox}} Mkhitaryan couldn't take part and wasn't listed in the squad at the [[2013 DFL-Supercup]] which his club won due to an injury he received on a friendly game before that. Mkhitaryan debuted for Dortmund following his return from a three weeks sustained injury in the second round of 2013–14 Bundesliga on 18 August 2013 in a home victory over [[Eintracht Braunschweig]] at [[Signal Iduna Park]].{{cite web |url=http://sport.news.am/eng/news/28202/mkhitaryan-happy-that-borussia-won.html|title=Mkhitaryan happy that Borussia won| publisher=sport.news.am|date=19 August 2013 |accessdate=19 August 2013}} Mkhitaryan's first two Bundesliga goals were decisive in a 2–1 win over [[Eintracht Frankfurt]] to keep Dortmund in first place in the Bundesliga.{{cite web|url=http://www.bvb.de/?k%E5%85%ECY%1B%E7%F4%9C%5Co%E3%8D%99|title=2–1: Mkhitaryan seals fourth BVB win with two goals | publisher = Borussia Dortmund | date = 1 September 2013 | accessdate = 8 September 2013}} His first Champions League goal for Dortmund came in a 2–1 away win against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]]. Mkhitaryan finished his season with nine goals and ten assists in the Bundesliga and was included in the WhoScored Bundesliga Team of the Season.{{cite web | url = http://www.sports.ru/football/1020710220.html | script-title=ru:Мхитарян попал в символическую сборную чемпионата Германии по версии официального сайта Бундеслиги | language = ru | publisher = sports.ru | date = 20 May 2014 | accessdate = 21 May 2014}}{{cite web | url = http://www.whoscored.com/Articles/78ylhxlirkgaac1jq3vd-g/Show/League-Focus-Bundesliga-201314-Season-Review | title = League Focus: Bundesliga 2013/14 Season Review | publisher = whoscored.com | date = 12 May 2014 | accessdate = 21 May 2014 | first = Andy | last = Brassell}} His team finished runner-up at the [[2013–14 Bundesliga]], and runner-up for the [[2013–14 DFB-Pokal]]. ====2014–15 season==== The first trophy Mkhitaryan won with Dortmund was the [[2014 DFL-Supercup]], scoring the first goal in the 2–0 victory over [[Bayern Munich]].{{cite web|url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/13/borussia-dortmund-bayern-munich-german-supercup-match-report|title= Borussia Dortmund beat Bayern Munich to win German Supercup again|date=13 August 2014|work=Guardian|accessdate=20 November 2014}} In September 2014, Mkhitaryan suffered an injury that sidelined him for a month{{cite web | url = http://www.sports.ru/football/1023754768.html | title = Мхитарян выбыл на месяц из-за травмы голеностопа | language = ru | publisher = sports.ru | date = 21 September 2014 | accessdate = 26 December 2014}} and on 13 December 2014 he was injured again.{{cite web | url = http://www.sports.ru/football/1025721964.htm | title = Мхитарян не выйдет на поле до конца 2014 года | language = ru | publisher = sports.ru | date = 14 December 2014 | accessdate = 26 December 2014 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20141226130516/http://www.sports.ru/football/1025721964.htm | archive-date = 26 December 2014 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }} He scored the second goal of a 3–0 win against [[Revierderby|rivals]] [[Schalke 04]] on 28 February 2015.{{cite news|title=Borussia Dortmund continue revival with three-goal spree to beat Schalke|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/feb/28/borussia-dortmund-schalke-bundesliga-match-report|accessdate=20 August 2015|work=[[The Guardian]]|publisher=Reuters|date=28 February 2015}} ====2015–16 season==== On 6 August 2015, Dortmund played against [[Wolfsberger AC]] in the third qualifying round second leg of the Europa League, [[Thomas Tuchel]]'s first home match as coach. Mkhitaryan scored a late hat-trick for a 5–0 victory, 6–0 on aggregate.{{cite news|title=Borussia Dortmund 5 Wolfsberger 0 (6–0 agg): Mkhitaryan lights up Tuchel home bow|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/borussia-dortmund-5-wolfsberger-0-6-0-agg-mkhitaryan-lights-tuchel-home-bow|accessdate=7 August 2015|work=[[FourFourTwo]]|date=6 August 2015}} Three days later, he scored the second goal in a 2–0 win at [[3. Liga]] club [[Chemnitzer FC]] in the first round of the [[2015–16 DFB-Pokal|DFB-Pokal]].{{cite news|title=Chemnitzer 0–2 Borussia Dortmund: Aubameyang & Mkhitaryan see BVB through|url=http://www.goal.com/en/match/chemnitzer-fc-vs-borussia-dortmund/2038928/report|accessdate=14 August 2015|publisher=Goal.com|date=9 August 2015}} On 15 August 2015, Mkhitaryan scored a brace in a 4–0 win against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] in the first league game of the season.{{cite news|title=Bor Dortmd 4–0 Borussia Monchengladbach|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33541336|accessdate=15 August 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 August 2015}} Five days later, he headed the winning goal as Dortmund came from 3–0 down to win 4–3 at [[Odds BK]] in the first leg of their Europa League [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|play-off]].{{cite news|title=Odd 3 Dortmund 4: Mkhitaryan seals remarkable comeback|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/odd-3-dortmund-4-mkhitaryan-seals-remarkable-comeback|accessdate=20 August 2015|work=FourFourTwo|date=20 August 2015}} In the second round of the domestic cup on 28 October 2015, Mkhitaryan scored the final goal of a 7–1 rout of [[SC Paderborn 07]].{{cite news|title=Bor Dortmd 7–1 SC Paderborn 07|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34621132|accessdate=28 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 October 2015}} Eight days later, his goal confirmed a 4–0 home win over [[Gabala FK]], securing a place in the [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League knockout phase|last 32 of the Europa League]].{{cite news|last1=Buczko|first1=Stefan|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan stars for Borussia Dortmund in Europa League win|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/club/borussia-dortmund/124/blog/post/2700706/henrikh-mkhitaryan-stars-for-borussia-dortmund-in-europa|accessdate=8 November 2015|publisher=ESPN|date=6 November 2015}} On 20 April 2016, Mkhitaryan was one of three goalscorers as Borussia won 3–0 away at [[Hertha BSC]] in the semi-final of the DFB-Pokal.{{cite news|url=http://www.dw.com/en/marco-reus-drives-borussia-dortmund-past-hertha-berlin-to-german-cup-final/a-19201920|title=Marco Reus drives Borussia Dortmund past Hertha Berlin to German Cup final|date=20 April 2016|work=Deutsche Welle | access-date = 21 April 2016}} At the end of the season, Mkhitaryan was voted the Bundesliga Players' Player of the Season.{{cite web | url = http://asbarez.com/150847/henrikh-mkhitaryan-voted-bundesligas-player-of-the-season/ | title = Henrikh Mkhitaryan Voted Bundesliga’s Player of the Season | date = 25 May 2016 | website = asbarez.com | access-date = 30 May 2016}}{{cite web | url = http://sport.news.am/eng/news/67769/mkhitaryan-truly-honored-to-be-voted-best-player-of-the-season!.html | title = Mkhitaryan: Truly honored to be voted Best Player of the Season! | website = sport.news.am | date = 25 May 2016 | access-date = 30 May 2016}} He finished the league as the assist leader with 15 assists.{{cite web | url = http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/stats?competition=4&season=2015&category=STANDARD&pos=0&team=0&isOpp=0&splitType=0&sort=6&sortOrder=0 | title = 2015–16 Bundesliga Player Standard Stats by Assists | website = FOX Soccer | access-date = 30 May 2016}}{{cite web | url = http://www.worldfootball.net/assists/bundesliga-2015-2016/ | title = Bundesliga 2015/2016 – Assists | website = worldfootball.net | access-date = 30 May 2016}} ===Manchester United=== [[File:Mkhitaryan 144856.jpg|left|thumb|Mkhitaryan [[Goal celebration|celebrating scoring a goal]] for Manchester United in 2016.]] On 2 July 2016, Dortmund chief executive [[Hans-Joachim Watzke]] said that the sale of Mkhitaryan to England's [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] would be inevitable as the player would leave for free had he stayed one more year.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36693832|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: Man Utd sign forward, say Borussia Dortmund|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 July 2016|accessdate=2 July 2016}} Four days later, Mkhitaryan joined them on a four-year contract for a transfer fee reported variously as between £27 million and £30 million,{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-united-new-boy-henrikh-8455588|title=Manchester United new boy Henrikh Mkhitaryan sets sights on title success|work=Daily Mirror|last=Burrows|first=Ben|date=20 July 2016|accessdate=9 August 2016}} with the option to extend for a further year.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Jul/Manchester-United-confirms-signing-of-Henrikh-Mkhitaryan-from-Borussia-Dortmund.aspx|title=United sign Henrikh Mkhitaryan|website=ManUtd.com|publisher=Manchester United|date=6 July 2016|accessdate=6 July 2016}} He became the first Armenian to join a Premier League club.{{cite news|last1=Kearns|first1=Sean|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan set to become first Armenian to play in the Premier League after joining Manchester United|url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/07/06/henrikh-mkhitaryan-set-to-become-first-armenian-to-play-in-the-premier-league-after-joining-manchester-united-5990619/|accessdate=26 December 2016|work=Metro|date=6 July 2016}} Mkhitaryan made his debut in a 2–0 victory in a pre-season match against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 15 July 2016.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jul/16/manchester-united-beat-wigan-jose-mourinho-first-game-luke-shaw|title=Manchester United beat Wigan 2–0 in José Mourinho’s first game in charge|work=The Guardian|date=16 July 2016|accessdate=16 July 2016}} On 7 August 2016, he made his competitive debut as a stoppage-time substitute in a 2–1 victory against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]] in the [[2016 FA Community Shield]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36934956|title=Leicester City 1–2 Manchester United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 August 2016|accessdate=24 August 2016}} He became the first Armenian to play in the Premier League on 14 August 2016 when he came on as a 75th-minute substitute for [[Juan Mata]] in a 3–1 away victory against [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite news|last1=Ghazanchyan|first1=Siranush|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: Honored to be the first Armenian in the Premier League – Video|url=https://www.armradio.am/en/2016/07/06/henrikh-mkhitaryan-honored-to-be-the-first-armenian-in-the-premier-league-video/|accessdate=6 July 2016|publisher=Public Radio of Armenia|date=6 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/man-utd-signing-mkhitaryan-first-armenian-and-112th-nationality-in-premier-league-4142382|title=Man Utd signing Mkhitaryan first Armenian and 112th nationality in Premier League|publisher=Tribal Football|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=24 August 2016}} He made his first Premier League start for Manchester United in the [[Manchester derby]] on 10 September 2016, but he was substituted at half-time.{{cite web | url = https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/sep/10/jose-mourinho-claudio-bravo-red-rooney-tackle-penalty | title = José Mourinho criticises players and Mark Clattenburg after derby loss | website = The Guardian | date = 11 September 2016 | access-date = 11 September 2016 | first = Daniel | last = Taylor}} On 8 December 2016, Mkhitaryan scored his first goal for the club, away against [[FC Zorya Luhansk|Zorya Luhansk]], in Manchester United's last group match of the [[2016-17 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2017/matches/round=2000792/match=2019499/index.html|title=Zorya Luhansk vs Manchester United|website=uefa.com | access-date = 9 December 2016}} Three days later, in United's next game, Mkhitaryan scored his first Premier League goal (and his first goal at [[Old Trafford]]) in a 1–0 victory over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]]; however, he left the game in the second half after suffering an ankle injury in a tackle by [[Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990)|Danny Rose]].{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/Fixtures-And-Results/Match-Reports/2016/Dec/Match-Report-Manchester-United-1-Tottenham-Hotspur-0-Premier-League.aspx|website=manutd.com | title = Manchester United vs Tottenham Hotspur 1–0 | access-date = 11 December 2016}} He returned from this injury two matches later, coming off the bench to score United's third goal against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]], a [[scorpion kick]] which he described as being the best goal he had ever scored.{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2016/Dec/player-reaction-henrikh-mkhitaryan-describes-brilliant-strike-v-sunderland-as-his-best-ever-goal.aspx|website=manutd.com | title = Mkhitaryan: It's My Best Goal Ever| date = 27 December 2016 | access-date = 27 December 2016 | first = Mark | last = Froggatt}} He scored in the [[2017 UEFA Europa League Final|2017 Europa League final]] to help Manchester United beat [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] 2–0,{{cite web|url=http://www.manutd.com/en/News-And-Features/Football-News/2017/May/Manchester-United-win-the-Europa-League-after-beating-Ajax-in-the-final-in-Stockholm-24-May-2017.aspx|website=manutd.com | title= United are Europa League Winners|date = 25 May 2017| access-date = 25 May 2017 | first = Adam| last = Higgins}} and became the first Armenian to win a major European trophy.{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Rory|title=Manchester United’s Henrikh Mkhitaryan Brings Armenia With Him|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/05/24/sports/soccer/henrikh-mkhitaryan-armenia.html?_r=0|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=24 May 2017}} [[File:Manchester United v West Ham United, 13 August 2017 (23).JPG|thumb|right|Mkhitaryan preparing to take a free kick against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] during the early [[2017–18 Premier League]]]] In the first three matches of the [[2017–18 Premier League]] season, Mkhitaryan assisted a record-equalling five goals.{{cite web|last1=Bairner|first1=Robin|title=Mkhitaryan Equals Premier League Record with Rashford Assist|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/news/mkhitaryan-equals-premier-league-record-with-rashford-assist/zgmsrbqrcxz71rd88rea4mm2l|website=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|accessdate=11 September 2017|date=26 August 2017}} However, he soon struggled for form and was axed from the starting line-up since United's 4–1 victory over [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]]. ===Arsenal=== [[File:18 Merci Arsène - Celebrating Iwobi's goal (41955274491).jpg|thumb|left|Mkhitaryan (right) with [[Alex Iwobi]] playing for [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in 2018.]] On 22 January 2018, [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] announced the signing of Mkhitaryan from Manchester United, as part of a swap deal with [[Alexis Sánchez]] moving in the other direction. On 3 February 2018, he made his first start for Arsenal in a 5–1 home win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], claiming three assists.{{cite news|title=Arsenal 5-1 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42842344|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 February 2018}} Mkhitaryan returned from injury to face Manchester United at Old Trafford, scoring Arsenal's only goal in an eventual 2–1 loss, refusing to celebrate the goal out of respect for his former team.{{cite web | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43854104 | title = Manchester United | website = 2-1 Arsenal | date = 30 April 2018 | access-date = 29 April 2018}} ==International career== [[File:Algérie - Arménie - 20140531 - 17.jpg|thumb|upright|Mkhitaryan with [[Armenia national football team|Armenia]] in 2014]] Mkhitaryan debuted for the [[Armenia national football team|Armenia national team]] in an away [[exhibition game|friendly match]] against [[Panama national football team|Panama]] on 14 January 2007.{{cite news|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Liverpool want Armenian midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/22937049|accessdate=12 October 2013|date=18 June 2013|agency=[[BBC Sport]]}} He scored six goals for Armenia in [[UEFA Euro 2012]] [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group B|qualifying Group B]], thus becoming top goalscorer in that group.{{cite web|title=EC Qualification|url=https://int.soccerway.com/international/europe/european-championship-qualification/2012-poland-ukraine/qualifying-round/group-b/|publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=3 March 2013}} Although Armenia did not advance past the qualifying stage for UEFA Euro 2012, Mkhitaryan's performances landed him in the UEFA Euro 2012 Qualifying Dream Team with six goals. On 10 September 2013, in the absence of regular skipper goalkeeper [[Roman Berezovsky]], Mkhitaryan captained his country for the first time, as they lost 0–1 at home to [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] in [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|World Cup qualification]].{{cite news|last1=Bruun|first1=Peter|title=Agger on the spot as Denmark down Armenia|url=http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008546/postmatch/report/|accessdate=26 April 2015|publisher=UEFA|date=10 September 2013}} He became the top scorer in the history of the Armenian national team, after scoring his 12th goal for the national team in a 1–3 defeat to [[Italy national football team|Italy]] in another qualifier on 15 October. This surpassed the 11 scored for the nation by [[Artur Petrosyan]].{{cite web | url = http://www.rg.ru/2013/10/16/armenia-site-anons.html | script-title=ru:Генрих Мхитарян стал лучшим бомбардиром в истории сборной Армении | language = ru | publisher = rg.ru | date = 16 October 2013 | accessdate = 8 September 2014}} On 27 May 2014, he scored twice in a 4–3 friendly win against the [[United Arab Emirates national football team|United Arab Emirates]] at the [[Stade de la Fontenette]] in [[Carouge]], Switzerland.{{cite news|last1=Ghazanchyan|first1=Siranush|title=Armenia beats UAE 4–3|url=http://www.armradio.am/en/2014/05/27/armenia-beats-uae-4-3/|accessdate=26 April 2015|publisher=Public Radio of Armenia|date=27 May 2014}} Two years and a day later, he scored Armenia's first international hat-trick in a 7–1 friendly win over [[Guatemala national football team|Guatemala]] in Los Angeles.{{cite news|title=Armenia beat Guatemala 7–1: Mkhitaryan nets hattrick|url=https://www.armradio.am/en/2016/05/29/armenia-beat-guatemala-7-1-mkhitaryan-nets-hattrick/|accessdate=29 May 2016|publisher=Public Radio of Armenia|date=29 May 2016}} ==Style of play== Mkhitaryan is an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]], who is also capable of playing as a [[Forward (association football)#Second striker|second striker]] or as a [[Forward (association football)#Winger|winger]]. He excels playing in a central role, just behind the [[Forward (association football)#Striker|strikers]], where he often looks to link up with his teammates in and around the penalty area. He is known for his ability to draw away opposing defenders and, in turn, create space for his teammates to exploit, leading to goal scoring opportunities, courtesy of his offensive movement, technique, and vision. Mkhitaryan has also been praised for his precise [[Passing (association football)|passing]], [[Dribbling#Association football|dribbling]] ability, creativity, ball control and [[work rate]], as well as his eye for the final pass; his skill and trickery on the ball enables him to beat defenders in one on one situations. Furthermore, he possesses an accurate shot.{{cite web|title=UEFA Champions League: 4 players to keep an eye out for.|url=http://tikitakastyle.wordpress.com/tag/henrikh-mkhitaryan/|publisher=tikitakastyle.wordpress.com|accessdate=3 March 2013 | date = 18 September 2012}}{{cite web|title=Mkhitaryan is one of the best footballers of the Ukraine cup: Buryak|url=http://lurer.com/?p=36069&l=en|publisher=Lurer.com|accessdate=3 March 2013 | date = 14 August 2012}} During the 2012–13 season, former Scottish footballer [[Pat Nevin]] said of Mkhitaryan, "Eleven goals in eight league matches already is fantastic, but when you add that he is a midfielder, it is phenomenal. You may not have heard of him yet, even if all the scouts at the top European clubs have, but you soon will. He has pace, skill, a rocket of a shot and the ability to arrive in the box like [[Frank Lampard]]. This all singles him out as a player who must be watched or more importantly marked."{{cite web|title=PAT NEVIN: GROUP TASK|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2915434|publisher=www.chelseafc.com|accessdate=3 March 2013|date=11 September 2012|first=Pat|last=Nevin|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120921161849/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2915434|archivedate=21 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} ==Personal life== Mkhitaryan has been nicknamed ''Heno'' (Հենո), short for Henrikh, by his fans in Armenia, which he appreciates the informality of.{{cite news |last1=Poghosyan |first1=Yekaterina |date=18 January 2012 |title=Հենրիխ Մխիթարյան. "Ամենակարեւորն այն է, որ երեխադ լավ մարդ մեծանա" |url=http://www.mediamax.am/am/news/off-the-record/3644/?fb_comment_id=10150531318547280_20725364#f9d7b4d6cbff4c |language=Armenian |work=mediamax.am}} Soon after joining Borussia Dortmund, he was often nicknamed ''Micki'' by international fans.{{cite news |title=Dortmund-Neuzugang Mücke heißt jetzt Micki |url=http://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/henrikh-mkhitaryan/heisst-jetzt-micki-31311300.bild.html |language=German |work=Bild.de |date=15 July 2013 |access-date=15 July 2013}} Mkhitaryan did not approve of this and personally asked his fans to respect his Armenian family name, stating, “I have come to a foreign country and respect its laws and traditions, but I do want them to respect my love for homeland and my roots. I will not adapt and change anything. I’m going to score goals, then they will definitely remember my name.”{{cite news |last=Krylov |first=Nikita |date=22 August 2013 |title=Генрих Мхитарян: Я не собираюсь менять свое имя |url=http://www.sovsport.ru/news/text-item/635409 |language=Russian |work=Sovetskiy Sport |access-date=22 August 2013}}{{cite news |title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: Respect my name |url=https://sport.news.am/eng/news/28351/henrikh-mkhitaryan-respect-my-name.html |work=NEWS.am Sport |date=22 August 2013 |access-date=22 August 2013}} He revealed in an interview that it was Borussia manager [[Jürgen Klopp]] who gave him that nickname because his surname is too long to pronounce, and he later responded that it is OK to use that nickname.{{cite news|last1=Luckhurst|first1=Samuel|title=Manchester United player Henrikh Mkhitaryan explains his nickname|url=http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-news-henrikh-mkhitaryan-12606327|work=[[Manchester Evening News]]|date=15 February 2017}}{{cite news|last1=Harvey|first1=Colin|title=Man Utd's Henrikh Mkhitaryan explains nickname given to him by Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/588713/Henrikh-Mkhitaryan-Manchester-United-news-nickname|work=[[Daily Star (British newspaper)|Daily Star]]|date=16 February 2017}} His verified [[Instagram]] account is named ''micki_taryan''.{{cite web|title=micki_taryan|url=https://www.instagram.com/micki_taryan/|publisher=instagram.com}} Mkhitaryan is a [[polyglot]],{{cite news|last1=Ghazanchyan|first1=Siranush|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan: A classy player, an outstanding personality, a well-educated polyglot…|url=http://www.armradio.am/en/2013/02/27/11034/|agency=[[Public Radio of Armenia]]|date=27 February 2013}} who speaks seven languages: [[Armenian language|Armenian]], [[French language|French]], [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]], [[Russian language|Russian]], [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]], [[English language|English]], and [[German language|German]]. He attributes his knowledge of Russian to his maternal grandmother, who was of [[Russians|Russian]] ethnicity.{{cite web | url = http://www.golosarmenii.am/article/49845/genrix-mxitaryan-kazhdyj-poluchaet-svoj-shans | title = Генрих Мхитарян: "Каждый получает свой шанс" | language = ru | website = [[Golos Armenii]] | date = 13 February 2017 | access-date = 28 May 2017}} He learned the first three languages in his childhood, while the latter four he picked up playing in Ukraine, Germany, and England. Shakhtar's [[Donbass Arena]] has a tradition of playing music each time home players score goals, with a track corresponding to the nationality of a scorer. "[[Sabre Dance]]" by Armenian composer [[Aram Khachaturian]] was played whenever Mkhitaryan scored. This song became very popular in Donetsk due to Mkhitaryan scoring frequently.{{cite news|title=Henrik Mkhitaryan orchestrates Shakhtar Donetsk's great leap forward|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/oct/22/henrik-mkhitaryan-shakhtar-donetsk|accessdate=9 June 2013|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|date=22 October 2012 | first = Jonathan | last = Wilson}} In 2012, by the decision of the [[Yerevan City Council]], and in connection with the city's 2,794th anniversary, Mkhitaryan was awarded with the "Honorary Citizen of Yerevan" title, for his great success in football and his brilliant achievements in sports.{{cite web|script-title=hy:Հենրիխ Մխիթարյանը` Երեւանի պատվավոր քաղաքացի|url=http://sport.news.am/arm/news/13023/henrikh-mkhitaryany-erevani-patvavor-qaxaqaci.html|publisher=sport.news.am |accessdate=1 March 2013 | language = Armenian|date=13 October 2012}} Mkhitaryan has visited [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]] three times on charity visits. In December 2011, Mkhitaryan visited [[Stepanakert]], capital of the disputed territory, and donated gifts to the families of fallen soldiers. He was subsequently awarded the NKR Prime Minister’s medal.{{cite web|title=Henrikh Mkhitaryan presented gifts to the families of fallen soldiers|url=http://armenianow.com/sports/soccer/34154/henrik_mkhitaryan_football_charity_karabakh|accessdate=16 August 2013 | date = 15 December 2011}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 27 February 2019|{{cite news|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/henrikh-mkhitaryan/39797/|title=Armenia – H.
